drupalNodeEvent.title: "China's global leadership after 2022: opportunities and constraints"

field_speakers.processed:
Kerry Brown , Professor of Chinese Studies and Director of the Lau China Institute at King’s College, London.

Scott Kennedy, Senior Adviser and Trustee Chair in Chinese Business & Economics, CSIS | Center for Strategic & International Studies

Dmytro Yefremov, Ph.D. in Economics, Assistant Professor at the Chair of International Relations of Kyiv Mohyla Academy, the Board member of the Ukrainian Association of Sinologists

Liu Yawei, Ph.D, Director of the China Program at The Carter Center

Qinduo Xu, Political analyst, researcher on Chinese Foreign Policy at Pangoal Institution, Beijing

field_organizers.processed:
Ukrainian Association of Sinologists

A. Krymskyi Institute of oriental studies, NAS of Ukraine

Publishing House "Helvetica"

field_description.processed:
Dear colleagues,
 
Welcome to register for the international roundtable “China's Global Leadership after 2022: opportunities and constraints”. The event will take place on December 20th at 3-5 p.m. (Kyiv time) on the Ukrainian platform for Contemporary China (online).
 
Please visit the following website to sign up  https://china-leadership.org/
 
The event will be moderated by Isabel Hilton, founder of the ChinaDialogue.net platform. 
 
Kerry Brown (Great Britain), Scott Kennedy (USA), Dmytro Yefremov (Ukraine), Liu Yawei (China), Xu Qingdo (China) will participate in the discussion.
 
The organizers of the event: Ukrainian Association of Sinologists, A. Krymskyi Institute of Oriental Studies of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine and the Publishing House “Helvetica”.
